pity.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: sympathy for a person or animal who is suffering or unhappy
pity.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: I listened to Jason’s story with pity.
I hated the thought of being an object of pity (=someone who other people feel sorry for).
He sounded so upset that Leah started to take pity on him.
He looked exhausted, but Marie felt no pity for him.
pity.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 2: sympathy for a person or animal who is suffering or unhappy
pity.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: No one can look at these photographs and not feel pity.
He was expecting a prison sentence but the judge took pity on him.
be filled with pity/full of pity
His heart was filled with pity for them.
Annie experienced a sudden feeling of pity for the young man.
The woman looked so dejected that a wave of pity washed over me.
Charles even felt a twinge of pity for Mrs Sweet.
He was a proud man and he didn't want to be treated as an object of pity.
pity.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: to feel sorry for someone because they are in a very bad situation
pity.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: I pity anyone who has to feed a family on such a low income.
Sam pitied his grandmother there alone, never going out.
Pity the poor teachers who have to deal with these kids.
pity.translation[1].definitions[0].note_: In everyday English, people usually say that they feel sorry for someone rather than pity them:
I feel sorry for his wife.
